img.data-caption: MCTC PLTW teachers Jim Spurling and Scott Furey make 109 3D printed N95 masks for WV. WV State Police help with distribution.

img.data-caption: Students in the page program go to Charleston to learn about the legislative process.
img.alt: Students in the page program go to Charleston to learn about the legislative process.

img.data-caption: Natalie Lynch from New Creek Primary was named the Young Writers' Winner for grades 3-4.
img.alt: Natalie Lynch from New Creek Primary was named the Young Writers' Winner for grades 3-4.

img.data-caption: Team members are: Adam Jones, Andrew McDowell, Trey Kitzmiller, and Hayden Wyatt from Keyser Middle School. They are coached by Tommy Nester.
img.alt: Team members are: Adam Jones, Andrew McDowell, Trey Kitzmiller, and Hayden Wyatt from Keyser Middle School. They are coached by Tommy Nester.

img.data-caption: Jillian Deloughery, student at Burlington Primary, was named the Young Writers' Winner for grades 1-2.
img.alt: Jillian Deloughery, student at Burlington Primary, was named the Young Writers' Winner for grades 1-2.

img.data-caption: Meghann Griffith and Grace Scott from FMS were named Young Writers' Winners for grades 5-6 and 7-8.
img.alt: Meghann Griffith and Grace Scott from FMS were named Young Writers' Winners for grades 5-6 and 7-8.

img.data-caption: Zoe Goddard from KHS was named the Young Writers' Winner for Grades 11-12
img.alt: Zoe Goddard from KHS was named the Young Writers' Winner for Grades 11-12

img.data-title: COUNTY MIDDLE SCHOOL SCIENCE FAIR WINNERS!
img.data-caption: Animal Science: 1st place, Wyatt Royal, FMS
img.alt: Animal Science: 1st place, Wyatt Royal, FMS

img.data-caption: Behavioral and Social Sciences: 1st place, Celia Cole, KMS; 2nd place, Kylee Saville, FMS; and 3rd place, Lily Jones, KMS.
img.alt: Behavioral and Social Sciences: 1st place, Celia Cole, KMS; 2nd place, Kylee Saville, FMS; and 3rd place, Lily Jones, KMS.

img.data-caption: Biochemistry: 1st place, Isaac Jones, KMS.
Biomedical & Health Sciences: 1st place, Nathaniel Lewis, KMS; 2nd place, Brigham Lott, FMS; and 3rd place, Erika Michaels, FMS.
img.alt: Biomedical & Health Sciences: 1st place, Nathaniel Lewis, KMS; 2nd place, Brigham Lott, FMS; and 3rd place, Erika Michaels, FMS.

img.data-caption: Chemistry: 1st place, Brianna Kelly, FMS; 2nd place, Ashlyn Saville, KMS;and 3rd place, Charleen Cryser, KMS. Honorable Mention was presented to Caden Michaels, FMS.
img.alt: Chemistry: 1st place, Brianna Kelly, FMS; 2nd place, Ashlyn Saville, KMS;and 3rd place, Charleen Cryser, KMS. Honorable Mention was presented to Caden Michaels, FMS.

img.data-caption: Earth Science and Environmental Science: 1st Place, Alexandra Hartung, FMS; 2nd place, Elizabeth Clark, FMS; and 3rd place, Ella Chambers, FMS.
img.alt: Earth Science and Environmental Science: 1st Place, Alexandra Hartung, FMS; 2nd place, Elizabeth Clark, FMS; and 3rd place, Ella Chambers, FMS.

img.data-caption: Energy: 1st place, Jada Patton, FMS.
Engineering: 1st place, Quinn Mandell, FMS; and 2nd place, Shane Hicks, KMS.
img.alt: Engineering: 1st place, Quinn Mandell, FMS; and 2nd place, Shane Hicks, KMS.

img.data-caption: Materials Science: 1st place, Raley Nestor, FMS; 2nd place, Aubrey Fisher, KMS; and 3rd place, Abigail Del Signore, KMS.
img.alt: Materials Science: 1st place, Raley Nestor, FMS; 2nd place, Aubrey Fisher, KMS; and 3rd place, Abigail Del Signore, KMS.

img.data-caption: Microbiology: 1st place, Kayla Morgan, FMS.
Physics and Astronomy: 1st place, Kendall Kelly, FMS; 2nd place, Kylie Keplinger, KMS; and 3rd place, Addison Tharp, FMS. Honorable Mention was presented to Skylar Robey, FMS.

img.alt: Plant Sciences: 1st place, Phoebe McCann, FMS; and 2nd place, Brooke Kesner, KMS

img.data-caption: The FFA Meats Evaluation Team who won 1st place in a state career development event were recognized at a board of education meeting. Pictured are: Sarah Sions, Adam Iser, Evan Matlick, Dylan Wilson and Superintendent Ravenscroft.
img.alt: The FFA Meats Evaluation Team who won 1st place in a state career development event were recognized at a board of education meeting. Pictured are: Sarah Sions, Adam Iser, Evan Matlick, Dylan Wilson and Superintendent Ravenscroft.

span.b: NEW TEMPORARY PRE-K/HEAD START ENROLLMENT DURING COVID-19

div.style: color: black; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; background-color: white
color: black; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; background-color: white

ul.li: Complete the P-Steps application Online at: https://mineral.preschoolsteps.org
Email a scan or photo of the following documents to bkesner@k12.wv.us (Please type the word ENROLLMENT in the subject line to ensure that the email goes into the correct folder):

ol.li: Proof of Income: Tax return for 2019 (1040), W-2's, or 4 recent check stubs.

li.span: One Proof of residency (Utility Bill, Mortgage statement, rental agreement, or updated WV Drivers License)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont

li.span: If documents cannot be emailed, please mail them to:

ul.li: After online application and documents are received, an application packet which will include a self-addressed stamped envelope will be mailed to you. Please complete these forms and return them to your HOME SCHOOL in the self-addressed envelope.
Once the application documents are received back in the Home School, the application process will continue.

div.style: color: #201f1e; font-size: 15px; font-family: Lucida Sans Unicode, Lucida Grande, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; background-color: white
color: black; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; background-color: white

div.div: Mineral County Pre-K/Head Start is a Program that serves Four Year Old's, we also serve 3-year old's that are Head Start Eligible, on IEP, in Foster Care or receive McKinney Vento services.

div.span: PARENTS OF EPIPEN USERS, please see document listed below for important information.

a.span: Coronavirus 19 Information - West Virginia Department of Education

p.span: The West Virginia Department of Education (WVDE) is working closely with the Office of Governor Jim Justice, the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources, and other state agencies and organizations to ensure counties and schools have the latest information regarding Coronavirus Disease 19 (COVID-19).

div.span: Available through the Office of Student Services.

strong.span: Mineral County Schools is now accepting nominations for Teacher of the Year.
Please review nomination form for details.
